definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: These new roles show the twoness of the peasants' identities and occupations.
sentences.chinese: 这些角色体现出农民身份与职业的二重性现状。

sentences.english: The double images of the eagle deeply reflect the internal contradiction of Du Fu's character.
sentences.chinese: 雕意象的二重性深刻地体现了杜甫人格的内在矛盾。

sentences.english: The pursuit reveals the duality of the modern college.
sentences.chinese: 追求揭示了现代大学的二重性。

sentences.english: Duality of teaching means pre-design and generative in the process of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 教学二重性指教学过程中的预设性和生成性。

sentences.english: And only in becoming the devotee does this duality of intimacy and distance disappear.
sentences.chinese: 只有成为皈依者，亲密和距离的二重性才会消失。

sentences.english: Split personality refers to the dual characters of good and evil.
sentences.chinese: “分裂人格”指人格的善恶二重性。

sentences.english: The principle of duality is the basis of the double-entry bookkeeping system on which accounting is based.
sentences.chinese: 二重性是复式簿记系统为基础的会计基本原则。

sentences.english: The economic globalization which is the wave tide of the revolution of world industry have "twoness".
sentences.chinese: 当今的经济全球化的实质具有“二重性”。

sentences.english: The twoness of area main body is having main effect to the development of economic area.
sentences.chinese: 区域主体的二重性对经济区域的发展起着重要影响。

definition: epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
inner transcendence (perfection through one's own inner moral cultivation, as in Confucianism, for example)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
